title.narrative: GICHD, Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining, 2019-2022
GICHD, Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining, kärnstöd 2019-2022

description.narrative:
Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD) is an international expert organisation working to reduce the impacts of mines, cluster munition, and other explosive hazards in close partnership with national authorities, mine action organisations and other human security actors. The GICHD has been a cooperating partner to Sida for about ten years and are now applying for core support for the strategy period 2019 to 2022.
Overall, the GICHD's work can be divided into three pillars. These are Knowledge and Research, Norms and Standards, and Capacity Development. On Knowledge and Research the organisation aims to enhance expertise, methods and good practice of mine action, as well as develop innovative tools and technologies for clearance. Their work with Information Management helps national authorities and mine action organisations with the collection, analysis and timely provision of information to support clearance operations. On behalf of the United Nations, the GICHD also develops, maintains and promotes the International Mine Action Standards (IMAS). Their work on Norms and Standards centres around promoting instruments of international law, norms and standards, and evidence-based policies. The focus on Capacity Development is undertaken by providing advisory services and trainings on all aspects of mine action; institutional, strategic, managerial and operational, primarily for national authorities.
In the new GICHD strategy for 2019 - 2022 the organisation is outlining strategic changes it aims to undertake, both organisational and thematic. As the environment in which the GICHD operates are in constant flux, the potential partner recognizes the necessity of adapting. The strategic changes mirror the key challenges facing demining and risk reduction going forward. These new changes include an elevated focus on gender and diversity, increasing expertise on Small Arms and Light Weapon questions including ammunition management, strengthening their country focus, increasing their work with building resilience to hazards, and researching best practices of mine action operations in urban environments. The Gender and Mine Action Programme (GMAP), which is an expert organisation that works to increase awareness of gender and diversity within mine action, will be integrated into the GICHD during the beginning of the implementation period. This integration will, for example, enable the GICHD to better position themselves in the forefront of mine action by strengthening their gender and diversity capacity. One of the benefits of the merger for GMAP is that it will enable them to strengthen the gender focus of the collaboration with national authorities and as such push for greatest possible impact of their work.

Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining (GICHD) är en internationell expertorganisation som arbetar med att minska effekterna av minor, klusterammunition och andra explosiva ämnen i nära samarbete med nationella myndigheter, minhanteringsorganisationer och andra aktörer som arbetar med att främja mänsklig säkerhet. De är baserade i Geneve och har för närvarande 70 anställda från 22 olika länder. GICHD är sedan en längre tid en av Sidas globala samarbetspartners inom strategin för Hållbar Fred och söker nu kärnstöd för strategiperioden 2019–2022.
GICHD:s arbete vilar på tre pelare - forskning och kunskapsutveckling, normer och standards samt kapacitetsutveckling. Initiativen som kategoriseras inom den första pelaren ämnar bidra till höjd expertis och förbättrade metoder och verktyg inom röjning av minor och klusterammunition. Vidare arbetar de med informationshantering genom att hjälpa nationella myndigheter samt minhanteringsorganisationer att samla, analysera och dela kunskap som stödjer minhanteringsinsatser. GICHD har vidare fått mandat av FN att utgöra sekretariat för 'International Mine Action Standards' (IMAS). GICHD:s arbete med normer och standards handlar om att stötta efterlevandet av internationell rätt och internationella standarder samt bidra till evidensdriven policyutveckling. När det gäller organisationens arbete med kapacitetsutveckling fokuserar GICHD på att erbjuda utbildningar om de institutionella, strategiska och operationella dimensioner som är kopplade till minhantering, främst till nationella myndigheter.
I GICHD:s strategi för 2019 - 2022 framgår strategiska förändringar som organisationen ämnar genomföra, både organisatoriska och tematiska. Eftersom den globala miljön GICHD arbetar i är i ständig förändring krävs det att GICHD också utvecklas. De strategiska förändringar som GICHD planerar speglar de huvudsakliga utmaningarna som en humanitär minhanteringsaktör står inför. Mer specifikt ämnar GICHD öka deras fokus på gender och mångfald, börja arbeta mer med små och lätta vapen-frågor bland annat genom ammunitionskontroll, bygga ut sin kapacitet för ett fördjupat landfokus, arbeta mer med att bygga motståndskraft mot minor genom minrisksutbildningar samt bedriva forskning kring minhanteringsinsatser i urbana miljöer. Under början av implementeringsperioden ämnas 'Gender and Mine Action Programme' (GMAP), en expertorganisation som arbetar med att öka kunskap och medvetenhet om gender och mångfald inom minhanteringsinsatser, integreras i GICHD. Denna integrering ämnar bland annat möjliggöra för GICHD att positionera sig i framkant bland aktörer som arbetar för att främja mänsklig säkerhet genom ökad kapacitet i jämställdhets- och genusfrågor. För GMAP öppnar integreringen till exempel dörrar för att arbeta närmre nationella myndigheter och på så sätt få större genomslag på sitt arbete.

participating-org.narrative: GICHD/Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining
GICHD/Geneva International Centre for Humanitarian Demining

sector.narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.
11.7 - By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.

11.7 - Senast 2030 tillhandahålla universell tillgång till säkra, inkluderande och tillgängliga grönområden och offentliga platser, i synnerhet för kvinnor och barn, äldre personer och personer med funktionsnedsättning.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.2 - Eliminera övergrepp, utnyttjande, människohandel och alla former av våld eller tortyr mot barn.
16.2 - End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children.

2.3 - By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous peoples, family farmers, pastoralists and fishers, including through secure and equal access to land, other productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment.

2.3 - Till 2030 fördubbla jordbrukets produktivitet och inkomster för småskaliga livsmedelsproducenter, i synnerhet kvinnor, ursprungsfolk, familjejordbrukare, boskapsskötande nomader samt fiskare, inklusive genom säker och lika tillgång till mark, andra produktionsresurser och insatsvaror, kunskap, finansiella tjänster och marknader samt möjligheter till värdeskapande och sysselsättning utanför jordbruket.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Avtal mellan Sida och Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining om kärnstöd 2020-2023, insats 12983
Beslut om insats - GICHD, Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining, insats 12983

description.narrative:
2019 was the first year of implementing the GICHD's new strategic plan. Progress was made on several of the areas of growth identified in the strategy. Some immediate results of this are already seen, but mostly the process oriented results with the integration of the Gender and Mine Action Programme (GMAP) into GICHD and the establishment of the Ammunition Management Advisory Team (AMAT) lays a good foundation for increased impact in the coming years.
Integration of GMAP One of the key developments in 2019 is the integration of GMAP (which previously was a separate NGO) into the organisation. This has contributed to increased capacity of the GICHD when it comes to gender and diversity. The integration was done in March 2019 and although some results can already be observed, more can be expected in the coming years. In GICHDs 2019 annual gender and diversity staff survey completed by 98% of its staff, 75% of staff agreed or strongly agreed that GMAPs integration positively impacted the way the GICHD works towards gender equality and inclusion.
Establishment of AMAT The GICHD, in partnership with the United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs (UNODA), established in 2019 the Ammunition Management Advisory Team (AMAT), a team that is part of the GICHD and is dedicated to supporting national, regional and global efforts for the improvement of ammunition management. In 2019, AMAT set up its team of research, programming and technical experts, laid out its four-year strategy, based on the GICHDs own strategy, and established the AMAT Advisory Council, tasked with a programmatic advisory function. In its first year of operation, AMAT raised awareness among policymakers and relevant stakeholders at the state level. Government and military buy-in was expressed via the acknowledgement of AMAT in the draft UN Resolution 74/53 as the mechanism in charge of supporting states in the safe and secure management of ammunition through the provision of technical advice and services. It should be noted though that AMAT is funded by dedicated project funding and that Sida's core support was not used to finance AMAT.
Explosive Ordinance Risk Education The casualty rate from explosive ordnance reported globally has risen dramatically in the past few years. A rapid EORE Sector Mapping and Needs Analysis published by the GICHD in 2019 also indicates that the risk education pillar of mine action suffered for years from the lack of dedicated resources and funding. During 2019, the GICHD actively supported its partners in establishing the EORE Advisory Group (AG) and successfully advocating for EORE to have its own dedicated section with concrete actions in the 2019 Oslo Action Plan of the APMBC.
Examples of other results One of the GICHD main areas of work is supporting governments to develop national mine action strategies. In 2019, the organisation focused significantly on supporting Angola in developing their national strategy and Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo and Sri Lanka formally approved the strategies which GICHD had helped develop in previous years. Another area of work is information management where a key result in 2019 was the role out of the upgraded Information Management System for Mine Action (IMSMA Core) to 7 of UNMAS country programmes. In addition, 16 governments were support in various ways in the area of information management.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
